title: Clippy failed to automatically apply fix: type `bool` cannot be dereferenced
body:
Clippy tried to fix some of my code and ran in to issues, and suggested I file a bug report. I've made a stripped back reproduction of what I saw. I tried this code: ```rust fn main() { let input = ["once upon a time", "there was an example"]; let mut input_iter = input.iter(); let mut words = vec![]; for _ in 0..input.len() { words.push( input_iter .next() .unwrap() .split(' ') .filter(|x| *x != "") .collect::>(), ); } println!("{:?}", words); } ``` also accessible via playground here: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=829b4f5637a0abf35608926439f1d1a6 Clippy reported: ``` --> src/main.rs:11:29 | 11 | .filter(|x| *x != "") | ^^^^^^^^ help: using `!is_empty` is clearer and more explicit: `!*x.is_empty()` | = note: `#[warn(clippy::comparison_to_empty)]` on by default = help: for further information visit https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html#comparison_to_empty ``` when applying the fix clippy discovered: ``` The following errors were reported: error[E0614]: type `bool` cannot be dereferenced --> src/main.rs:11:30 | 11 | .filter(|x| !*x.is_empty()) | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^ error: aborting due to previous error ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.57.0 (f1edd0429 2021-11-29) binary: rustc commit-hash: f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c commit-date: 2021-11-29 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.57.0 LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` Also happens in nightly: ``` rustc --version --verbose rustc 1.59.0-nightly (efec54529 2021-12-04) binary: rustc commit-hash: efec545293b9263be9edfb283a7aa66350b3acbf commit-date: 2021-12-04 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.59.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 ```
Backtrace

Backtrace doesn't do anything in this case. ``` ```
